title: Newsom Score for Non-traumatic Chest Pain
description: Rules out need for chest X-ray in patients with chest pain (non-traumatic). The score uses 12 clinical criteria to identify low-risk patients who do not require chest radiography, with a sensitivity of 92.9% and negative predictive value of 98.4%.

parameters.name: age_60_or_more
parameters.description: Is the patient 60 years old or older?

parameters.name: chf_history
parameters.description: Does the patient have a history of congestive heart failure (CHF)?

parameters.name: smoking_history
parameters.description: Does the patient have a smoking history (current or former)?

parameters.name: hemoptysis
parameters.description: Does the patient have hemoptysis (coughing up blood)?

parameters.name: tuberculosis_history
parameters.description: Does the patient have a history of tuberculosis?

parameters.name: thromboembolic_history
parameters.description: Does the patient have a history of thromboembolic disease (PE, DVT)?

parameters.name: alcohol_abuse
parameters.description: Does the patient have prior or current alcohol abuse?

parameters.name: respiratory_rate_high
parameters.description: Is the patient's respiratory rate >24 breaths per minute?

parameters.name: diminished_breath_sounds
parameters.description: Does the patient have diminished breath sounds on examination?

parameters.name: rales
parameters.description: Does the patient have rales (crackles) on lung auscultation?

ranges.interpretation: This patient has no risk factors present and is considered low risk. Chest x-ray is not needed based on the Newsom Score criteria. The negative predictive value is 98.4%, making it highly unlikely that a clinically significant finding would be missed.

This patient has one or more risk factors present. Consider obtaining a chest x-ray as clinically significant findings may be present. The score has 92.9% sensitivity for detecting abnormal chest x-ray findings such as pneumonia, congestive heart failure, or pleural effusion.

references: Rothrock SG, Green SM, Costanzo KA, Fanelli JM, Cruzen ES, Pagane JR. High yield criteria for obtaining non-trauma chest radiography in the adult emergency department population. J Emerg Med. 2002 Aug;23(2):117-24. doi: 10.1016/s0736-4679(02)00496-1.

Newsom C, Jeanmonod R, Woolley W, et al. Prospective Validation and Refinement of a Decision Rule to Obtain Chest X-ray in Patients With Nontraumatic Chest Pain in the Emergency Department. Acad Emerg Med. 2018 Jun;25(6):650-656. doi: 10.1111/acem.13380.
formula: Newsom Score = Sum of all positive criteria (1 point each)
notes: This score is designed for non-traumatic chest pain patients in the emergency department
The score has a sensitivity of 92.9% and negative predictive value of 98.4%
Application of this rule could reduce chest x-ray utilization by approximately 28.9%
Always use clinical judgment alongside this score
Not validated for traumatic chest pain
